alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN MECKLENBURG...SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND...PRINCE EDWARD...LUNENBURG...WESTERN NOTTOWAY...WESTERN AMELIA AND SOUTHWESTERN POWHATAN COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Evergreen to near Mt Laurel. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Darlington Heights around 600 PM EDT. Hampden Sydney and Prospect around 610 PM EDT. Farmville and Hampden Sydney College around 620 PM EDT. Longwood University and Kells Corner around 625 PM EDT. Rice, Green Bay, and Rehoboth around 630 PM EDT. Lunenburg around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bacons Fork, Tuggle, Wilburn, Angola, Arvins Store, Murdocks, Nutbush, Finneywood, Forksville, and Hawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward
